scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Information
scopecontent.p: This collection contains two letters of Conrad Aiken. In the first, Conrad Aiken, Washington, D.C. writes to Miss Maxon and expresses his appreciation for her poetry, "...I likethese poems, I like the feeling of them...they're good, they're firm, they're observed, and in at least one, Jazz Line, with an adroit and sinewy coil of movement. Go ahead, and the rest will come, if you work, and if also you don't forget to have funwith it." 1956 Mar 7. 1 p. TLS.

In the second letter, Aiken, Brewster, Massachusetts writes to Mary D. Wright, Poetry Editor, Saturday Evening Postand commends her ideas for the Saturday Evening Postand sends her several poems for possible publication. 1961 Jul 12 1 p.TLS.
